Uses of Class
uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.transceiver.SpinnmanException

Packages that use SpinnmanException 
Package Description
uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.transceiver
How to actually talk to a SpiNNaker machine.

  • Uses of SpinnmanException in uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.transceiver

    Subclasses of SpinnmanException in uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.transceiver 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  CoresNotInStateException
    Cores failed to reach a given state within a timeout.
    class  ProcessException
    Encapsulates exceptions from processes which communicate with some core/chip.
    Methods in uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.transceiver that throw SpinnmanException 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default void TransceiverInterface.executeApplication​(ExecutableTargets executableTargets, AppID appID)
    Execute a set of binaries that make up a complete application on specified cores, wait for them to be ready and then start all of the binaries.
    void Transceiver.waitForCoresToBeInState​(CoreSubsets allCoreSubsets, AppID appID, java.util.Set<CPUState> cpuStates, java.lang.Integer timeout, int timeBetweenPolls, java.util.Set<CPUState> errorStates, int countBetweenFullChecks)  
    default void TransceiverInterface.waitForCoresToBeInState​(CoreSubsets coreSubsets, AppID appID, java.util.Set<CPUState> cpuStates)
    Waits for the specified cores running the given application to be in some target state or states.

    Constructors in uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.transceiver that throw SpinnmanException 
    Constructor Description
    Transceiver​(java.net.InetAddress hostname, MachineVersion version)
    Create a Transceiver by creating a UDPConnection to the given hostname on port 17893 (the default SCAMP port), and a BootConnection on port 54321 (the default boot port), discovering any additional links using the UDPConnection, and then returning the transceiver created with the conjunction of the created UDPConnection and the discovered connections.
    Transceiver​(java.net.InetAddress host, MachineVersion version, java.util.Collection<BMPConnectionData> bmpConnectionData, java.lang.Integer numberOfBoards, java.util.Set<ChipLocation> ignoredChips, java.util.Map<ChipLocation,​java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> ignoredCores, java.util.Map<ChipLocation,​java.util.Set<Direction>> ignoredLinks, boolean autodetectBMP, java.util.List<Transceiver.ConnectionDescriptor> scampConnections, java.lang.Integer bootPortNumber, java.lang.Integer maxSDRAMSize)
    Create a Transceiver by creating a UDPConnection to the given hostname on port 17893 (the default SCAMP port), and a BootConnection on port 54321 (the default boot port), optionally discovering any additional links using the UDPConnection, and then returning the transceiver created with the conjunction of the created UDPConnection and the discovered connections.
    Transceiver​(Machine machine)
    Given a machine, make a transceiver for talking to all boards of that machine.
    Transceiver​(MachineVersion version)
    Create a transceiver.
    Transceiver​(MachineVersion version, java.util.Collection<Connection> connections)
    Create a transceiver.
    Transceiver​(MachineVersion version, java.util.Collection<Connection> connections, java.util.Collection<ChipLocation> ignoredChips, java.util.Map<ChipLocation,​java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> ignoredCores, java.util.Map<ChipLocation,​java.util.Set<Direction>> ignoredLinks, java.util.Collection<Transceiver.ConnectionDescriptor> scampConnections, java.lang.Integer maxSDRAMSize)
    Create a transceiver.
